module.name: property_space
module.keywords: module, physical quantity, property, characteristic, space

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies the nature of a physical quantity value in terms of the physical phenomenon that is observed or measured.

A set of values or magnitudes of a physical phenomenon is a physical quantity space. A particular value or magnitude of a physical phenonmenon is a physical quantity value which is a member of the physical quantity space.

example.p: Temperature is a physical quantity space.
400 degrees Celsius is a physical quantity value within the space of temperatures.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies a range of instances physical quantity value, which can have an upper and a lower bound. A physical quantity value is often not known exactly, and in this case, a range of which it is known to be a member can be specified.
purpose.example: Mass between 9.9 kg and 10.1 kg is a physical quantity range.
purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies the nature of a relationship between a physical object and a physical quantity.

example.p: 'Mass when empty' is a class of relationship between physical objects that can be full or empty, such as vessels, and the physical quantity space 'mass'.

li.example: Mass is a physical quantity space.
Temperature is a physical quantity space.
Mass between 9.9 kg and 10.1 kg is a physical quantity range.
Temperature between 400 degrees Celsius and 410 degrees Celsius is a physical quantity range.

li.p: the tensor order and symmetry of a physical quantity space;
li.example: Temperature is a scalar space. Stress is a symnmetric second order tensor space.
Elasticity is a symmetric fourth order tensor space.

li.p: a relationship with a physical quantity space.
li.example: 'Mass when empty' is a relationship between physical objects that can be full or empty, such as vessels, and the physical quantity space 'mass'.
'Normal operating pressure' is a relationship between a physical object that contains a fluid under pressure and the physical quantity space 'pressure'.

note.p: An physical quantity value is a class that an individual physical object can be a member of. The class indicates the nature of an observable or measurable aspect of the individual physical object.
The mass of 10 Kg is a physical quantity value. The widget with serial number 1234 in its state at 10:30 on 1998-11-05 is a member of this class.
A physical quantity space is a class that an physical quantity value can be a member of. The class indicates the nature of the physical phenomenon.
Mass is a physical quantity space. The mass that is 10 Kg is a member of this physical quantity space.

li.note: A physical quantity value, is within the scope of the Independent_property_definition application module.

def.p: set of all values or magnitudes for a physical phenomenon

note.p: A physical quantity value is a class that a physical thing can be a member of. Whether or not a physical thing is a member of the class is determined by the result of an observation or measurement.

A physical quantity space is a class that a physical quantity value can be a member of. Whether or not a physical quantity value is a member of the class is determined by the nature of the physical phenomenon that is observed or measured.

def.note: The deprecated terms do not have the word 'space', which indicates that the set or space of all possible values rather than a particular value is intended. Hence a term, such as 'physical quantity', does not distinguish between 'temperature' - a space of possible values, and 'the temperature of 20 degrees Celsius' - a particular temperature value.

description.p: The Physical_quantity_space UoF identifies a physical quantity space and specifies its tensor order and symmetry.
description.note: This UoF distinguishes between a scalar physical quantity space such as 'pressure', and a second order tensor physical quantity space such as 'stress'.
description.p: The Physical_quantity_space UoF identifies a range of physical quantity values.
The Physical_quantity_space UoF defines a class of relationship between a class of physical object and a physical quantity space.

alt_map.description: If the described_element is a class of activity.
If the described_element is a class of product.
